functional_requirements.title: User Signup
functional_requirements.description: The system shall allow new users to register by providing a username, password, and selecting a role User, Admin, Super Admin). This establishes a persistent user account in the MySQL database.
functional_requirements.inputs: Username (unique string). Password (hashed string). Role selection (dropdown: User, Admin, Super Admin).
functional_requirements.system_behavior: Validates username uniqueness via MySQL query. Hashes password using Passport.js. Inserts user record into Users data store if valid. Handles duplicates by displaying error message. Redirects to login page upon success.
functional_requirements.outputs: Success message: "Account created successfully." Error message for duplicates: "Username already exists." New session- ready user profile.

functional_requirements.title: User Authentication and Login
functional_requirements.description: The system shall authenticate users upon login and redirect them to a role-specific dashboard.
functional_requirements.system_behavior: Queries MySQL Users store for matching credentials. Validates password hash via Passport.js. Establishes session with role assignment. Redirects: User to personal dashboard, Admin to all-tasks view, Super Admin to full management dashboard. Invalid credentials trigger error display and retry option. Outputs: Role-specific dashboard HTML page. Error message: "Invalid credentials."
functional_requirements.outputs: Role-specific dashboard HTML page. Error message: "Invalid credentials."

functional_requirements.title: Task Management Operations
functional_requirements.description: Authenticated users shall create, edit, delete tasks, and mark them as complete or incomplete, with visibility restricted by role.
functional_requirements.inputs: Task details: title, description (for create/edit). Task ID (for edit/delete/mark). Completion status toggle.
functional_requirements.system_behavior: For create: Inserts into MySQL Tasks store, associated with user ID. For edit/delete/mark: Updates/deletes specific record via Task ID. Role enforcement: Users access own tasks; Admin/Super Admin access all. Realtime UI updates post-operation.
functional_requirements.outputs: Updated task list on dashboard. Confirmation messages: "Task created/updated/deleted/marked."

functional_requirements.title: Task Filtering and Clearing
functional_requirements.description: The system shall filter tasks by status (all, active, completed) and allow clearing of completed tasks.
functional_requirements.inputs: Filter selector: "All", "Active", "Completed". Clear request (button for completed tasks).
functional_requirements.system_behavior: Queries MySQL Tasks store with status filter. Displays filtered list dynamically. On clear: Deletes all completed tasks for the user/role scope. Refreshes dashboard post-clear.
functional_requirements.outputs: Filtered task list view. Confirmation: "Completed tasks cleared."

functional_requirements.title: Data Persistence
functional_requirements.description: Tasks and user data shall persist in MySQL and be visible only to the logged-in user.
functional_requirements.system_behavior: All CRUD operations commit to MySQL. Queries scoped by user ID/role. Ensures data integrity via transactions.
functional_requirements.outputs: Persistent, role-restricted data views. 4. Non-Functional Requirements

quality_requirements.title: Security
quality_requirements.description: Passwords shall be hashed using Passport.js before storage. Role-based access control enforces least privilege: Users see only personal tasks; higher roles extend visibility. Sessions must timeout after inactivity, with HTTPS enforcement in production. No unauthenticated access to dashboards or data.

quality_requirements.title: Usability
quality_requirements.description: The UI shall be responsive across mobile and desktop using Bootstrap, with intuitive elements like hover effects for edit/delete. Navigation must be straightforward, with clear feedback for all actions (e.g., success/error modals). Accessibility features include keyboard navigation and high-contrast modes where standard.

quality_requirements.title: Reliability
quality_requirements.description: The system shall maintain 99% uptime, with automatic data backups via MySQL. Error handling ensures graceful degradation; no single failure causes total outage. Data consistency preserved through ACIDcompliant transactions.

quality_requirements.title: Portability
quality_requirements.description: The web application shall function across major browsers Chrome, Firefox) without OS dependencies. Responsive design ensures compatibility with devices from 320px to 4K resolutions. Deploymentagnostic for Heroku-like platforms.

performance_requirements.title: Performance
performance_requirements.description: The system shall handle up to 100 concurrent users with task operations CRUD, filter) responding in under 1 second. Database queries must optimize for low latency, achieving 99th percentile response times below 500ms under load. Page load times on dashboards shall not exceed 2 seconds for typical use.
